answerText: Cuba[10] This Cuban author was among the first to pioneer magical realism, doing so in a novel in which Ti Noël helps Mackandal poison whites. He also wrote the novels Manhunt and Baroque Concert.
heading: QUARK |2012 | 1 | 12 | Literature | World | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: For 10 points each, answer some questions about the literature of a certain country. [10] This country's most important poet is probably José Martí, who wrote Versos Sencillos and agitated for the independence of this country. A popular patriotic song from this country is "Guantanamera," based on a Martí poem.
